class.name: Swashbuckler

t: one skill determined by your swashbuckler's style

flavor: Many warriors rely on brute force, weighty armor, or cumbersome weapons. For you, battle is a dance where you move among foes with style and grace. You dart among combatants with flair and land powerful finishing moves with a flick of the wrist and a flash of the blade, all while countering attacks with elegant ripostes that keep enemies off balance. Harassing and thwarting your foes lets you charm fate and cheat death time and again with aplomb and plenty of flair.

fluff.name: During Combat Encounters...
entries: You show off to gain panache, leveraging your flair to build up to powerful finishing moves. You stay nimble, moving into the best position to perform your maneuvers while dodging enemy blows and responding with swift ripostes. Depending on your swashbuckler's style, you might dance among your foes; slip past their defenses; or beguile, distract, or frighten them.

fluff.name: During social encounters...
entries: You are equally likely to charm or intimidate others—or both. You might be an adept socialite, or you might create distractions for others who do the talking.

fluff.name: While exploring...
entries: You keep a careful eye on your surroundings and other people, always prepared to leap into action with bravado and flair. You interact with the environment in bold, sweeping strokes rather than skulking to avoid detection.

fluff.name: In downtime...
entries: You might carouse at the tavern, repair and maintain your armaments, or train to learn new techniques. To maintain your impressive reputation, you might build an organization in your name or establish a following of admirers.

items: Portray yourself as a heroic daredevil or a roguish braggart, knowing you can live up to the image you present.
Hold yourself in high esteem, confident in your abilities and your reputation.
Practice your skills and maneuvers regularly to ensure you never grow rusty.
Admire your theatrics, bravado, and skill with a blade.
Find you arrogant unless they know you well enough to appreciate your style.
Underestimate how much of a threat you pose until they face the end of your deadly blade.

summary.text: The swashbuckler earns panache through showy acts and leverages this flair to thwart their foes.

classFeature.name: Ancestry and Background
entries: In addition to what you get from your class at 1st level, you have the benefits of your selected ancestry and background.

classFeature.name: Initial Proficiencies
entries: At 1st level, you gain a number of proficiencies that represent your basic training. These proficiencies are noted at the start of this class.

classFeature.name: Panache
entries: You care as much about the way you accomplish something as whether you actually accomplish it in the first place. When you perform an action with particular bravado, you can leverage this moment of verve to perform spectacular, deadly maneuvers. This state of flair is called panache, and you are either in a state of panache or you are not.

You gain panache by successfully performing the skill check associated with specific actions that have a bit of flair, including {@action Tumble Through} and additional actions determined by your swashbuckler's style (see below). At the GM's discretion, after succeeding at a check to perform a particularly daring action, such as swinging on a chandelier or sliding down a drapery, you also gain panache if your result is high enough (typically the very hard DC for your level, but the GM can choose a different threshold).

While you have panache, you gain a +5-foot status bonus to your Speeds and gain a +1 circumstance bonus to checks to {@action Tumble Through} or to take any actions that give you panache due to your style. The precise strike class feature also causes you to deal extra precision damage while you have panache. Powerful finisher actions, including {@action Confident Finisher}, can be used only while you have panache and cause you to lose your panache.
Normally, you gain and use panache only in combat encounters; when an encounter ends, you lose panache.

classFeature.name: Swashbuckler's Style
entries: As a swashbuckler, you have your own distinctive style that enables you to gracefully handle everyday events and life-or-death situations alike. Choose a swashbuckler's style. This style determines the additional actions you use to gain panache and makes you trained in the skill related to that action.

classFeature.name: Precise Strike
entries: You strike with flair. When you have panache and you {@action Strike} with an {@trait agile} or {@trait finesse} melee weapon or {@trait agile} or {@trait finesse} unarmed attack, you deal 2 additional precision damage. If the strike is part of a finisher, the additional damage is {@dice 2d6} precision damage instead

As your swashbuckler level increases, so does your additional damage for precise strike. Increase the amount of additional damage on a {@action Strike} and the number of additional dice on a finisher by one at 5th, 9th, 13th, and 17th levels.

classFeature.name: Confident Finisher
entries: You gain an elegant finishing attack you can make when you have panache. The {@trait finisher} trait is described on page 87. You gain the {@action Confident Finisher|APG} action.

entries.name: Confident Finisher
entries: You make an incredibly graceful attack, piercing your foe's defenses. Make a {@action Strike} with a weapon or unarmed attack that would apply your precise strike damage, with the following failure effect.

entries.Failure: You deal half your precise strike damage to the target. This damage type is that of the weapon or unarmed attack you used for the {@action Strike}.

classFeature.name: Swashbuckler Feats
entries: At 1st level and every even-numbered level, you gain an {@filter swashbuckler class feat|feats|type=class|classes=swashbuckler|level=[1;1]}.

classFeature.name: Skill Feats
entries: At 2nd level and every 2 levels thereafter, you gain a {@filter skill feat|feats|type=skill}. You must be trained or better in the corresponding skill to select a skill feat.

classFeature.name: General Feats
entries: At 3rd level and every 4 levels thereafter, you gain a {@filter general feat|feats|type=general}.

classFeature.name: Great Fortitude
entries: Your physique is incredibly hardy, granting you increased endurance. Your proficiency rank for Fortitude saves increases to expert.

classFeature.name: Opportune Riposte
entries: You turn the tables on foes who fumble, capitalizing immediately on their mistake. You gain the {@action Opportune Riposte|APG} reaction.

entries.name: Opportune Riposte
entries.trigger: A foe within your reach critically fails a {@action Strike} against you.
entries: You take advantage of an opening from your enemy's fumbled attack. You either make a melee {@action Strike} against the triggering foe or attempt to {@action Disarm} it of the weapon it used for the {@action Strike}.

classFeature.name: Skill Increases
entries: At 3rd level and every 2 levels thereafter, you gain a skill increase. You can use this increase to either become trained in one skill you're untrained in, or become an expert in one skill in which you're already trained.

At 7th level, you can use skill increases to become a master in a skill in which you're already an expert, and at 15th level, you can use them to become legendary in a skill in which you're already a master.

classFeature.name: Opportune Riposte
entries: You turn the tables on foes who fumble, capitalizing immediately on their mistake. You gain the Opportune Riposte reaction.

classFeature.name: Stylish Tricks
entries: At 3rd level, 7th level, and 15th level, you gain a {@filter skill feat|feats|type=skill}. This feat must be for {@skill Acrobatics} or the trained skill from your swashbuckler's style.

classFeature.name: Vivacious Speed
entries: When you've made an impression, you move even faster than normal, darting about the battlefield with incredible speed. Increase the status bonus to your Speeds when you have panache to a +10-foot status bonus; this bonus increases by 5 feet at 7th, 11th, 15th, and 19th levels. When you don't have panache, you still get half this status bonus to your Speed, rounded down to the nearest 5-foot increment.

classFeature.name: Ability Boosts
entries: At 5th level and every 5 levels thereafter, you boost four different ability scores. You can use these ability boosts to increase your ability scores above 18. Boosting an ability score increases it by 1 if it's already 18 or above, or by 2 if starts out below 18.

classFeature.name: Ancestry Feats
entries: In addition to the ancestry feat you started with, you gain an {@filter ancestry feat|feats|type=ancestry} at 5th level and every 4 levels thereafter.

classFeature.name: Weapon Expertise
entries: You've dedicated yourself to learning the intricacies of your weapons. Your proficiency ranks for simple weapons, martial weapons, and unarmed attacks increase to expert. You gain access to the critical specialization effects of all weapons for which you have expert proficiency.

classFeature.name: Evasion
entries: You've learned to move quickly to avoid explosions, a dragon's breath, and worse. Your proficiency rank for Reflex saves increases to master. When you roll a success on a Reflex save, you get a critical success instead.

classFeature.name: Weapon Specialization
entries: You've learned how to inflict greater injuries with the weapons you know best. You deal 2 additional damage with weapons and unarmed attacks in which you are an expert. This damage increases to 3 if you're a master and 4 if you're legendary.

classFeature.name: Exemplary Finisher
entries: You execute your finishing moves with spectacular flair, adding special effects to your finishers. If a Strike you make as part of a finisher hits a foe, you add one of the following effects to the Strike, depending on your swashbuckler's style.

classFeature.name: Swashbuckler Expertise
entries: You perform swashbuckling techniques with exceptional flair, making them harder to resist. Your proficiency rank for your swashbuckler class DC increases to expert.

classFeature.name: Continuous Flair
entries: While not equal to the heights of your panache in combat, you have a dramatic flair about you in any situation. Whenever you succeed at a check during exploration that would have granted you panache in combat, you gain a +1 circumstance bonus to further checks for actions that would grant you panache in combat. This benefit ends when the exploration changes to a different scene (as determined by the GM) or shifts to an encounter or downtime.

classFeature.name: Vigilant Senses
entries: Through your adventures, you've developed keen awareness and attention to detail. Your proficiency rank for {@skill Perception} increases to master.

classFeature.name: Improved Evasion
entries: Your ability to elude danger is matchless. Your proficiency rank for Reflex saves increases to legendary. When you roll a critical failure on a Reflex save, you get a failure instead. When you roll a failure on a Reflex save against a damaging effect, you take half damage.

classFeature.name: Light Armor Expertise
entries: You've learned how to dodge while wearing light or no armor. Your proficiency ranks for light armor and unarmored defense increase to expert.

classFeature.name: Weapon Mastery
entries: You fully understand your weapons. Your proficiency ranks for simple and martial weapons and unarmed attacks increase to master.

classFeature.name: Greater Weapon Specialization
entries: Your damage from weapon specialization increases to 4 with weapons and unarmed attacks in which you're an expert, 6 if you're a master, and 8 if you're legendary.

classFeature.name: Keen Flair
entries: You inflict particularly devastating attacks on even well-defended foes. When you Strike with a weapon or unarmed attack with which you have master proficiency, if you roll a 19 on the die and the roll is a success, you critically succeed instead.

classFeature.name: Resolve
entries: You've steeled your mind with resolve. Your proficiency rank for Will saves increases to master. When you roll a success on a Will save, you get a critical success instead.

classFeature.name: Eternal Confidence
entries: As a swashbuckler at the peak of your skill, you swell with confidence and bravado in every attack. Your proficiency rank for your swashbuckler class DC increases to master.

When you {@action Strike} as part of a finisher or {@action Opportune Riposte|APG}, you can give the {@action Strike} the failure effect from the {@action Confident Finisher} action, including the increase from {@feat Precise Finisher} if you have that feat. You can do so only if the {@action Strike} uses a weapon or unarmed attack that you could use for {@action Confident Finisher}.

classFeature.name: Light Armor Mastery
entries: Your skill with light armor improves, increasing your ability to dodge blows. Your proficiency ranks for light armor and unarmored defense increase to master.

entries.name: Battledancer
entries: To you, a fight is a kind of performance art, and you command your foes' attention with mesmerizing motions. You are trained in {@skill Performance} and gain the {@feat Fascinating Performance|CRB} skill feat. You gain panache during an encounter when the result of your {@skill Performance} check to Perform exceeds the Will DC of an observing foe, even if the foe isn't fascinated.

entries.name: Battledancer
entries: You can {@action Step|CRB} as a free action immediately after the finisher.

entries.name: Braggart
entries: You boast, taunt, and psychologically needle your foes. You are trained in {@skill Intimidation}. You gain panache during an encounter whenever you successfully {@action Demoralize} a foe.

entries.name: Braggart
entries: If the foe was temporarily immune to your {@action Demoralize}, their temporary immunity ends.

entries.name: Fencer
entries: You move carefully, feinting and creating false openings to lead your foes into inopportune attacks. You are trained in {@skill Deception}. You gain panache during an encounter whenever you successfully {@action Feint} or {@action Create a Diversion} against a foe.

entries.name: Fencer
entries: The foe is {@condition flat-footed} until your next turn.

entries.name: Gymnast
entries: You reposition, maneuver, and bewilder your foes with daring feats of physical prowess. You are trained in {@skill Athletics}. You gain panache during an encounter whenever you successfully {@action Grapple}, {@action Shove}, or {@action Trip} a foe.

entries.name: Gymnast
entries: If the foe is {@condition grabbed}, {@condition restrained}, or {@condition prone}, you gain a circumstance bonus to the damage roll equal to twice the number of weapon damage dice.

entries.name: Wit
entries: You are friendly, clever, and full of humor, always knowing just what to say in any situation. Your witticisms leave foes unprepared for the skill and speed of your attacks. You are trained in {@skill Diplomacy} and gain the {@feat Bon Mot|APG} skill feat. You gain panache during an encounter whenever you succeed at a {@feat Bon Mot|APG} against a foe.

entries.name: Wit
entries: The foe takes a –2 circumstance penalty to attack rolls against you until the start of your next turn.
